intro: Solanum pelliceum, commonly known as the velvetleaf nightshade, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped, velvety leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant produces berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Solanum pelliceum belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other economically important plants like tomatoes and potatoes. It is often found in disturbed habitats and can be invasive in certain areas.
